title: Mick Gould
text:
Michael "Mick" Gould (born 1930), is an <a href="Irish%20people">Irish</a> former <a href="Gaelic%20football">Gaelic football</a>er who played as a right corner-back for the <a href="Cork%20GAA">Cork</a> senior team.
Gould joined the team during the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship%201950">1950 championship</a> and was a regular member of the starting fifteen for a number of seasons until his retirement following the completion of the <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship%201959">1959 championship</a>. During that time he won two <a href="National%20Football%20League%20%28Ireland%29">National League</a> medals and two <a href="Munster%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">Munster</a> medals in 1956 and 1957 but failed to capture an <a href="All-Ireland%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">All-Ireland</a> medal. He represented Munster in the Railway Cup through the 1950s.
At club level Gould is a double senior football <a href="Cork%20Senior%20Football%20Championship">county championship</a> medalist with <a href="Macroom%20GAA">Macroom</a> in 1958 as captain, and again in 1962. He also played club football with <a href="UCD%20GAA">UCD</a>, with whom he won a Sigerson Cup medal in 1953. He previously won a schools hurling Harty Cup medal with St. Colmans Fermoy in 1948.
